newsitem.title: LATVIA: SHARE ACTIVITY EDGES HIGHER, PRICES STABLE.
newsitem.headline: SHARE ACTIVITY EDGES HIGHER, PRICES STABLE.

text.p: Latvian shares were still stuck in
the summer doldrums on Tuesday as activity edged slightly higher
and prices remained more or less stable, dealers said.
Total turnover edged up to 78,000 lats from 76,000 lats
while the Rietumu Bank index slipped 0.96 percent to 150.96.
Dealers said the market was staying sluggish given a lack of
new factors and did not expect a pick up until after the summer
Unibanka led the market in terms of activity, trading 41,700
lats and losing three santimes to 3.30 lats.
Other shares were far behind it in turnover terms, with
fellow official list stock Daugavpils Chain the second busiest
on 11,000 lats but staying unchanged at 1.07 lats.
Valmiera Glassfibre lost one santime as it edged
down to 1.36 lats on turnover of 9,100 lats.
Kaija lost six santimes to 2.10 lats on trade of
